# Base Plot


## Base plot

To avoid repetitive code, we make a base plot:

```{r baseplot}
my_font <- "Roboto Condensed"
my_text_size <- 20
my_point_size <- 2.5
my_arrowhead <- arrowheadr::arrow_head_deltoid(2.1)
# my_colors <- viridis::viridis(2, begin = .25, end = .5)
my_colors <- c("#3B528B", "#21908C")
update_geom_defaults(geom = "richtext", 
                     new = list(family = my_font, 
                                size = .8 * my_text_size / ggplot2::.pt))

update_geom_defaults(geom = "labelpath", 
                     new = list(family = my_font,
                                size = .8 * my_text_size / ggplot2::.pt))

update_geom_defaults("point", list(size = my_point_size))
update_geom_defaults("arrow_segment", list(length_head = 5))
update_geom_defaults("arrow", list(linewidth = 2))

theme_set(
  theme_minimal(
    base_size = my_text_size, 
    base_family = my_font) +
    theme(axis.title.y = element_text(angle = 0, vjust = 0.5)))

bp <- ggplot() +
  coord_equal() +
  scale_x_continuous(labels = WJSmisc::signs_centered, limits = c(-4, 4)) +
  scale_y_continuous(labels = signs::signs, limits = c(-4, 4)) +
  theme_minimal(base_size = 16) +
  theme(
    axis.title.x =  element_text(face = "italic"),
    axis.title.y = element_text(
      face = "italic",
      angle = 0,
      hjust = .5,
      vjust = .5
    )
  )
```

# Polygons

The `pgon` function creates an object that connects points to make a polygon.

```{r fig-path}
#| fig-cap: Plotting a path.
p <- point(x = c(-4,-3, 4,  3, -1), 
           y = c( 0, 4, 3, -3, -4))
bp + 
  pgon(p, fill = "dodgerblue3")
```


# Polygon Labels

The label of a `pgon` object is placed, by default, at the centroid of the polygon. The centroid is the point whose x coordinate is the average of all the x coordinates of the polygon's points and whose y coordinate is likewise the average of all the point's y coordinates.


```{r fig-pgonlabel}
#| fig-cap: A path with a curved label
bp +
  pgon(
    p = p,
    label = label(
      "My<br>Polygon",
      size = 20,
      color = "white"
    ),
    fill = "dodgerblue4"
  )

```

# Connecting polygons

Connections between polygons are arrows that emanate from and point towards the polygons' centroids.

```{r fig-pgonconnect}
#| fig-cap: Arrow between two polygons
bp + 
  {p1 <- pgon(.5 * p - point(1.9,1.9), 
              fill = "dodgerblue4")} + 
  {p2 <- pgon(.5 * p + point(1.9, 1.9), 
              fill = "orchid4")} + 
  connect(p1, p2, 
          resect = 1, 
          label = ".45")
```
